text: {| style="margin:5px; border:1px solid #177245;" align=right cellpadding=3 cellspacing=3 width=400 |- align="center" bgcolor=#4169E1 |colspan=2| Kowree- Naracoorte-Tatiara Football League |- align="center" bgcolor="#eeeeee" || Established || 1993 |- align="center" || Teams || 11 |- align="center" bgcolor="#eeeeee" || 2018 Premiers || Mundulla |- align="center" || Most premierships || 10 - Mundulla |- align="center" bgcolor="#eeeeee" || 2018 Leading goalkicker || Fraser Williams (Padthaway ) 102 |} The Kowree- Naracoorte-Tatiara Football League is an Australian rules football competition based in the Limestone Coast region of South Australia, Australia. It is an affiliated member of the South Australian National Football League. One unusual aspect of the league is that it includes clubs from both South Australia and Victoria. The 2018 league medalist was Tim McIntyre and George Thring. ==Kowree-Naracoorte-Tatiara Football League== In 1993 the Kowree- Naracoorte Football League and the Tatiara Football League merged to form the Kowree-Naracoorte-Tatiara Football League. The founding clubs were Apsley, Border Districts, Bordertown, Edenhope, Kaniva & Districts, Keith, Kingston, Kybybolite, Leeor, Lucindale, Mundulla, Naracoorte, Padthaway and Penola. Kaniva & Districts and Leeor merged in 1997 to form Kaniva Leeor United. Apsley and Edenhope in 1999 merged to form Edenhope-Apsley and in 2006 moved to the Horsham & District Football League. == Current clubs == {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Jumper ! Club ! Nickname ! Years in comp ! Premierships ! Premiership Years |- | | Border Districts (Frances/Goroke) | Eagles | 1993- | - | - |- | center | Bordertown | Roosters | 1993- | 1 | 2012 |- |center | Kaniva Leeor United | Cougars | 1997- | - | - |- | center |Keith | Crows | 1993- | 2 | 2007, 2008 |- |center | Kingston | Saints | 1993- | - | - |- | center | Kybybolite | Tigers | 1993- | - | - |- | | Lucindale | Kangaroos | 1993- | 3 | 2005, 2011, 2017 |- | center | Mundulla | Tigers | 1993- | 11 | 1994, 1995, 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2002, 2004, 2018, 2019 |- | center | Naracoorte | Demons | 1993- | 3 | 2006, 2009, 2010 |- |center | Padthaway | Lions | 1993- | 3 | 1993, 2014, 2015 |- | center | Penola | Eagles | 1993- | 4 | 2001, 2003, 2013, 2016 |- |} ==History== ==Kowree-Naracoorte FL== This league was founded in 1937 when two competitions joined to create the Kowree-Naracoorte Football League. Towns of Apsley and Edenhope from the Shire of Kowree in Victoria got together with teams from Kybybolite, Frances and Naracoorte (North Naracoorte and South Naracoorte). After World War 2 Lucindale was admitted, then the two Naracoorte clubs merged to form Naracoorte, and Frances merged with Minimay to form Border Districts. The six team competition was later joined in the 1960s by Kingston and Padthaway. Penola joined from the Western Border Football League in 1988. ===KNFL Premiershttp://websites.sportstg.com/assoc_page.cgi?c=1-3798-0-0-0&sID;=279066=== * 1950 Edenhope * 1951 Kybybolite * 1952 Apsley * 1953 Naracoorte * 1954 Naracoorte * 1955 Apsley * 1956 Kybybolite * 1957 Edenhope * 1958 Edenhope * 1959 Naracoorte * 1960 Edenhope * 1961 Kybybolite * 1962 Border Districts * 1963 Naracoorte * 1964 Naracoorte * 1965 Apsley * 1966 Kybybolite * 1967 Border Districts * 1968 Kybybolite * 1969 Lucindale * 1970 Lucindale * 1971 Edenhope * 1972 Edenhope * 1973 Kybybolite * 1974 Kybybolite * 1975 Border Districts * 1976 Border Districts * 1977 Naracoorte * 1978 Naracoorte * 1979 Border Districts * 1980 Border Districts * 1981 Border Districts * 1982 Kingston * 1983 Kingston * 1984 Kingston * 1985 Apsley * 1986 Edenhope * 1987 Edenhope * 1988 Edenhope * 1989 Penola * 1990 Penola * 1991 Border Districts * 1992 Naracoorte ==Tatiara FL== Tatiara FL had its origins in 1911. Teams from Mundulla, Bordertown, Keith, Wolseley and Servicetown were later joined by Kaniva, Lillimur and Federals. Kaniva and Federals merged to form Kaniva & Districts in 1948, and Serviceton and Lillimur merged to form Leeor in 1950. Tintinara replaced Wolseley and the six team competition remain stable from the mid-1950s until 1991. In 1992 Tintinara withdrew and merged with Border Downs reducing the league to five clubs; this was thought as unworkable, therefore a league merger was sought. ===TFL
